meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insoluble.
meanings.sent1: The insolublenesses of the substance made it difficult to mix with water.
meanings.sent2: The chemist encountered insolublenesses when trying to dissolve the powder.
meanings.sent3: The insolublenesses of the puzzle left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like insolublenesses, impossible to break down.
meanings.sent5: The mystery surrounding the ancient artifact had an air of insolublenesses.

meanings.definition: The inability to be dissolved in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The insolublenesses of the sugar in the cold water surprised the students.
meanings.sent2: Oil and water demonstrate insolublenesses when mixed together.
meanings.sent3: The insolublenesses of the salt in the oil made for a strange experiment.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like insolublenesses, always staying strong.
meanings.sent5: The insolublenesses of the ink in the water created a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: The state of being impossible to solve or explain.
meanings.sent1: The insolublenesses of the riddle puzzled even the smartest detective.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher contemplated the insolublenesses of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The insolublenesses of the math problem made the students laugh in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The insolublenesses of human emotions are a mystery to many.
meanings.sent5: The insolublenesses of the ghost story kept the children up at night.
